overview: The Azure Local Hybrid Deployment Architecture integrates on-premises resources with Azure services, enabling the deployment of traditional and containerized applications while ensuring management and security through Azure tools.

components.name: Control Plane
components.description: Manages resources and services through Azure Portal, Azure CLI, and tools.
security_considerations: Access control policies must be enforced to limit who can manage resources.
Use of multi-factor authentication (MFA) for accessing the control plane.
vulnerabilities: Unauthorized access if credentials are compromised

components.name: Azure Local Instance
components.description: Hosts traditional applications and virtual machines (Arc VMs) on Hyper-V.
security_considerations: Regular patching and updates of the Hyper-V host OS.
Isolation of VMs to prevent lateral movement in case of a breach.
components.data_handling: Processes application data and VM configurations.

components.name: Kubernetes-based Applications
components.description: Supports containerized workloads via Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) enabled by Azure Arc.
security_considerations: Use of network policies to restrict pod communication.
Regular vulnerability scanning of container images.
components.data_handling: Handles application workloads and user data.

components.name: Validated Hardware
components.description: Includes physical machines validated for Azure Local deployment.
security_considerations: Ensure hardware is sourced from trusted vendors.

components.name: Networking
components.description: Comprises switches and firewalls to manage East/West traffic between local machines.
security_considerations: Implement segmentation to limit traffic between different workloads.
Regularly update firewall rules and configurations.
vulnerabilities: Misconfigured firewalls leading to unauthorized access

security_risks: Man-in-the-middle attacks if not properly secured
Data leakage if access controls are misconfigured

trust_boundaries.name: Cloud Integration Layer
recommendations: Use Azure Policy for compliance checks.
